name: Union Solidarity and Development Association
established/ intro statement: The Union Solidarity and Development Association (Burmese: ‡Û¥‡Û_‡Û_‡Û¼‡ÛÔ‡Û±‡ÛÂ‡Ûã‡Û¼‡ÛÉ‡Ûø‡ÛÛ‡Û_‡Û¦‡Ûá‡Û‡Û_‡Ûø‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûİ‡Û±‡Ûü‡ÛÓ‡Û_‡Ûã‡Ûá‡Û¼‡ÛĞ‡Û_‡Û¦‡Ûá‡ÛĞ‡Û_‡Û_‡Ûø‡Ûü‡Ûİ‡Û±‡Ûü‡ÛÁ‡Û_‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûü; MLCTS: prany htaung cu kri. re: hnang. hpwam. hprui: ye: a. sang: [pjÌÂdÌÊæ_ƒ«z‡_µ tƒ¥Ì£í¡kæ¡ÌÊƒ»ƒ« jÌ©i ní´ƒ»í¡ƒ« pæ¡æ_í¡ƒ«pæ¡jÌ_ jÌ©i ƒªëüƒ»íƒ«]; abbreviated USDA) was a Burmese political party founded with the active aid of Myanmar's ruling military junta, the State Law and Order Restoration Council (SLORC), on 15 September 1993.[1]

name: Myanmar Christian Fellowship of the Blind
cause_area: Well-being of all blind people, especially children aged from 5 to 25 no matter sex, race or religion
location: (Kawaichan), Yangon, Myanmar, and Myitkyina, Kachin State, Myanmar
established/ intro statement: Myanmar Christian Fellowship of the Blind, founded in 1975[1] is a non-profit organization that organized schools for the purpose of well-being of the Blind Christian in Myanmar.

name: Biodiversity and Nature Conservation Association
established/ intro statement: Biodiversity and Nature Conservation Association (BANCA) is a Burmese non-governmental organisation established in the capital city Yangon. The society aims to conserve natural diversity and promote awareness. It remains the leading force in Burma for biodiversity conservation and sustainable development.[1]

name: Union of Myanmar Federation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry
established/ intro statement: The Union of Myanmar Federation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry (Burmese: ‡ÛÛ‡Ûø‡ÛÓ‡Û¼‡Û_‡Û_‡Û¼‡Ûª‡ÛÈ‡ÛÂ‡Ûü‡ÛÓ‡Û_‡Ûã‡Ûá‡Û¼ ‡ÛÉ‡ÛÛ‡Û¼‡Ûª‡Û_‡Ûø‡ÛÏ‡ÛÛ‡Û¼‡Ûª‡Û_‡Ûø‡ÛÏ‡Ûø‡Û¥‡Û¼‡Ûã‡ÛÓ‡Û¼‡Ûü‡Ûİ‡Û_‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûª‡ÛÈ‡ÛÂ‡Ûü‡ÛÁ‡Û_‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûü), also called UMFCCI, is a national level non-governmental organization representing and safeguarding the interests of the private business sector.

name: Myanmar Writers and Journalists Association
established/ intro statement: The Myanmar Writers and Journalists Association (Burmese: ‡Ûª‡Û_‡ÛÓ‡Û¼‡Ûª‡ÛÂ‡ÛÉ‡ÛÂ‡Û¥‡Û±‡ÛÓ‡Û_‡Ûã‡Ûá‡Û¼ ‡ÛÉ‡ÛÂ‡ÛÓ‡Û_‡Û¼‡Ûà‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûü‡ÛÁ‡ÛĞ‡Û_‡Û_‡Ûá; MWJA) represents writers and journalists in Myanmar. At first closely associated with the Ministry of Information, in the 2011-2012 period the MWJA achieved greater independence.

name: Myanmar Women's Affairs Federation
established/ intro statement: Myanmar Women's Affairs Federation (‡Ûª‡Û_‡ÛÓ‡Û¼‡Ûª‡ÛÂ‡ÛÓ‡Û_‡Ûø‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûã‡Û¦‡ÛÁ‡Ûª‡ÛÈ‡Û_‡Ûø‡Ûü‡Û_‡Ûª‡Û¨‡Ûü‡Ûİ‡Û±‡Ûü‡Ûİ‡ÛÂ‡ÛÁ‡ÛĞ‡Û_‡Û_‡Ûá‡Û‡ÛÈ‡Ûø‡Û¥‡Û¼) is a non-governmental organisation based in Myanmar in promoting the welfare and advancement of Burmese women. This organisation is noticed by UN, WWF, Asia Regional Cooperation to Prevent People Trafficking (ARCPPT), and ASEAN, China Women Affair Organization.[citation needed] It has been listed as a GONGO for being a harsh critic of Aung San Suu Kyi and is purportedly ruled by wives of the Burmese junta.[1]

name: Myanmar Veterans' Organisation
established/ intro statement: The Myanmar Veterans' Organisation is the official organisation of veterans who have retired from the Myanmar Armed Forces (Tatmadaw).

name: Myanmar Red Cross Society
established/ intro statement: Myanmar Red Cross Society (MRCS) was founded in 1937 and it was earlier called Burma Red Cross. It has its headquarters in Yangon.

name: Foreign Correspondents' Club of Myanmar
established/ intro statement: The Foreign Correspondents' Club of Myanmar (Burmese: ‡Ûª‡Û_‡ÛÓ‡Û¼‡Ûª‡ÛÂ‡ÛÓ‡Û_‡Ûø‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûã‡Û¦ ‡ÛÓ‡Û_‡Ûø‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûã‡Û¦‡Û_‡Û‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûü‡ÛÔ‡Û±‡ÛÂ‡ÛÛ‡Û¼‡Ûª‡ÛÈ‡ÛÂ‡Ûü‡ÛÁ‡Û_‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûü; FCCM) is a members-only Foreign Correspondents' Club for the foreign media, business and diplomatic community based in Myanmar. FCCM was founded in 1989.[1]

name: Myanmar Motion Picture Organisation
established/ intro statement: Myanmar Motion Picture Organization is the official non-profit organisation for the Cinema of Burma. It was established on 8 March 1946.

name: Myanmar Medical Association
established/ intro statement: The Myanmar Medical Association (Burmese: ‡Ûª‡Û_‡ÛÓ‡Û¼‡Ûª‡ÛÂ‡ÛÓ‡Û_‡Ûø‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûã‡Û¦‡Û ‡Ûİ‡ÛÂ‡Û‡ÛÓ‡Û¼‡ÛÁ‡Û_‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûü; abbreviated MMA; formerly the Burma Medical Association) is Myanmar's only professional organisation of physicians.[1] MMA was founded in 1949 and has a current membership of approximately 17,000 members (2011).[2] It is administered by a central executive committee and is divided into 33 different societies dedicated to a broad range of medical specialties.[1] MMA holds an annual conference and also provides continued medical education for its members.[3] MMA publishes the Myanmar Medical Journal.

name: Myanmar Maternal and Child Welfare Association
cause_area: promoting the health and well being of mothers and children
established/ intro statement: The Myanmar Maternal and Child Welfare Association (Burmese: ‡Ûª‡Û_‡ÛÓ‡Û¼‡Ûª‡ÛÂ‡ÛÓ‡Û_‡Ûø‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûã‡Û¦ ‡Ûª‡Û_‡Û‡Ûã‡Û¼‡ÛÓ‡Û_‡Ûã‡Ûá‡Û¼‡ÛÛ‡ÛÏ‡Û±‡Ûü ‡ÛÉ‡Û±‡ÛÂ‡Ûã‡Ûá‡Û¼‡Ûİ‡Û_‡Û±‡ÛÂ‡ÛÛ‡Û¼‡Ûİ‡Û±‡Ûü ‡ÛÁ‡Û_‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûü, abbreviated MMCWA) is a non-governmental organisation in Burma which aims to protects mothers and their children in the country.

name: Myanmar Dental Association
established/ intro statement: The Myanmar Dental Association (Burmese: ‡Ûª‡Û_‡ÛÓ‡Û¼‡Ûª‡ÛÂ‡ÛÓ‡Û_‡Ûø‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûã‡Û¦ ‡Û_‡Û_‡ÛÂ‡Ûü‡ÛÓ‡Û_‡Ûã‡Ûá‡Û¼‡Û‡Û¦‡Û‡Û_‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûü ‡Û ‡Ûİ‡ÛÂ‡Û‡ÛÓ‡Û¼‡ÛÁ‡Û_‡Ûã‡Û¼‡Ûü; MDA) is a professional association established in 1979 which has more than 4,000 members.[1] The association publishes Myanmar Dental Journal every year.[2] It also arranges Myanmar Dental Conference in which FDI World Dental Federation speakers also make their presentations.[3] Myanmar Dental Association and Myanmar Dental Council are the only two professional organizations for Myanmar Dentists.
